frame.name: Extreme_value
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> possesses a <fen>Value</fen> for a certain <fen>Attribute</fen> which is extreme when compared to the values either of other entities or to values of the same <fen>Entity</fen> at other points of time.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Airfares</fex> <m>hit</m> a <fex name="Period">10-year</fex> <fex name="Value"><t>low</t></fex> today. <fex name="Attribute">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Period">Today's</fex> <fex name="Attribute">temperature</fex> <t>high</t> <m>was</m> <fex name="Value">71F</fex>, and the low was 50F. <fex name="Entity">INI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">The index</fex> hit a <fex name="Period">post crash</fex> <t>high</t> <fex name="Value">of 2,423.9</fex>. <fex name="Attribute">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex>By 1972, <fex name="Entity">the campus</fex> had <m>reached</m> a historic <fex name="Attribute">enrollment</fex> <t>high</t> <fex name="Value">of 6,300</fex>.</ex>
<ex>So, right after the company's IPO, you happily bought at the <t>high</t> <fex name="Value">of $14 per share</fex>, because you believed they were the first player into this market? <fex name="Attribute">DNI</fex> <fex name="Entity">INI</fex></ex>
<ex>We are currently expecting a <fex name="Attribute">price</fex> <fex name="Value"><t>low</t></fex> associated with the 9-Month (40-Week) Cycle. <fex name="Entity">INI</fex></ex>
<ex>The <fex name="Entity">Swiss</fex> <t>low</t> <fex name="Value">of 5.8 percent in 1999</fex> was followed by a high of 12.6 percent in 2001. <fex name="Attribute">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> of a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is extreme.
<ex><fex name="Entity">JetBlue's</fex> <t>high</t> of $55.15 was reached on May 6</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition:
<def-root>The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
<ex>East Harlem reached its historic <fex name="Attribute">population</fex> <t>high</t> of 210000 in 1950.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
<ex>The state of Michigan reported a new unemployment <t>high</t> <fex name="Value">of 7%</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period for which values of a particular <fen>Attribute</fen> of one or more entities are compared.
<ex>Food stamp error rates are at an <fex name="Period">all-time</fex> <t>low</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> for which there is a <fen>Value</fen> of an <fen>Attribute</fen> of an <fen>Entity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A characterization of some property of the Extreme_value. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the Extreme_value event occurs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: high.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a high point, level, or figure.

lexUnit.name: low.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low point, level or figure.

lexUnit.name: acme.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the highest point of achievement or excellence.

lexUnit.name: maximum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the greatest amount, extent, or intensity possible or recorded.

lexUnit.name: maximum.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: greatest in amount, extent, or intensity.

lexUnit.name: minimum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the least or smallest amount, extent, or intensity possible or recorded.

lexUnit.name: minimum.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: smallest or lowest in amount, extent, or intensity.
